title: Moana Chain: Cardano Partner Chain Prototype
summary: Cardano lacks a flagship multi-chain use case and Indigenous Peoples have no sovereign digital systems for identity, governance, or local economies.
solution: Prototype a sovereign Indigenous partner chain linked to Cardano, enabling culturally aligned identity, governance, and economic tools for communities.

- DAO tooling developer
- Tokenomics and governance systems designer

- Led multiple successful Catalyst projects

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The Moana Partner Chain introduces capabilities that have never existed on Cardano or in the wider Web3 ecosystem, bringing a genuinely new category of blockchain use case: sovereign Indigenous digital infrastructure connected to Cardano.



1. A First-of-Its-Kind Indigenous Sovereignty Chain on Cardano



Moana is the first Cardano-anchored blockchain designed specifically around Indigenous governance, identity, and local economies.

No previous Catalyst-funded project or Cardano ecosystem product has delivered:

- a sovereign chain governed by Indigenous authorities
- cultural governance encoded at the infrastructure level
- participation through community-run nodes, not centralised app
- Indigenous economic models built into the chain runtime



This is entirely new to Cardano.



2. A New Category of Multi-Chain Use Case for Cardano



Moana showcases how Cardano can anchor a federated, values-driven network of sovereign chains, demonstrating:



- Cardano Testnet anchoring
- metadata signalling
- stake snapshot ingestion
- future Minotaur hybrid consensus compatibility



This expands Cardano beyond dApps into sovereignty infrastructure, a category not previously explored.



3. Community-Controlled Digital Infrastructure (Not a Platform)



Unlike previous identity or governance projects (e.g., Atala PRISM pilots, Ahau, TribalDIDs/DAOs research, Amnesty DAO),

Moana enables communities to:

- join the network by deploying their own node,
- participate directly in on-chain authority,
- run local governance and identity registries on their own infrastructure.
- This shifts Indigenous participation from users to infrastructure operators, which is a major step forward.



4. Integrates and Evolves Prior Indigenous Innovation



Moana builds on the teams previous lessons from earlier projects but provides clear improvements:

- Ahau → focused on peer-to-peer genealogy; Moana extends into full governance + economies
- TribalDIDs → research; Moana operationalises identity at chain level
- TribalDAOs → governance theory; Moana encodes governance into runtime logic
- Atala PRISM → identity credentials; Moana builds sovereign chains to manage identity
- Amnesty Human Rights DAO → governance experimentation; Moana becomes the underlying infrastructure



Rather than rehashing prior work, Moana establishes the infrastructure layer those projects were missing.



5. Opens Cardano to New Global Indigenous Adoption Pathways



Moana is housed in the Pacific but supported by contributors from:

- Turtle Island
- Latin America
- Africa



No previous Cardano project has created a global Indigenous infrastructure network capable of driving on-chain activity from multiple regions and cultural contexts.



6. A New Blueprint for Culturally-Aligned Blockchain Design



Moana innovates by embedding:



- tikanga-aligned authority rotation
- Indigenous governance patterns
- community-driven identity models
- culturally grounded economic logic
- directly into the chain.

This has never been done in the Cardano ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The Moana prototype will demonstrate a fully operational version of the Moana Partner Chain, a sovereign Indigenous blockchain anchored to the Cardano Testnet. By the end of the project a complete, publicly accessible chain will be deployed and available for community testing.



The prototype will demonstrate:



- A running Proof-of-Authority Moana blockchain producing blocks
- Cardano Testnet integration, including metadata anchoring and stake snapshot ingestion
- Governance, identity, and token pallets operating inside the runtime
- Community participation through node deployment, allowing Indigenous organisations to join the network
- Sample dApps connected to the chain showing governance, identity, and economic features
- A public explorer and RPC endpoint for visibility and developer access



The prototype will be accessible through:



- The public Moana Testnet (RPC URLs, explorer, public bootnodes)
- The open-source GitLab repository with all code and documentation
- A community node deployment toolkit
- Public demo dApps connected to Moana



The community will be able to test the chain by:



- Running their own Moana nodes during the testnet phase
- Using the demo dApps to test identity registration, governance actions, and transactions
- Providing feedback during community calls and through GitLab issues
- Participating in governance simulations and stress tests
- Developers experimenting with or extending the runtime through open-source contributions



This prototype is designed to be fully testable on-chain and openly accessible to both Indigenous organisations and the wider Cardano community.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Short-term (0–12 months):



3–5 early adopter Indigenous organisations

~500–1,500 monthly users

3,000–10,000 Cardano-anchored metadata transactions per month



Medium-term (12–24 months):



10–20 Indigenous communities

5,000–20,000 active users

20,000+ cross-chain Cardano transactions per month



Long-term vision (3–5 years):



Dozens of federated Moana chains

Hundreds of Indigenous communities

Millions of Cardano-linked transactions annually



Housed in the Pacific but a growing global network of contributors in Turtle Island, LATAM, and Africa, this could become a major global adoption driver for Cardano, creating a network of real-world users that no other blockchain ecosystem is currently serving

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Mātou Collective is building a global network of Indigenous developers, researchers, designers, and entrepreneurs committed to developing digital infrastructure that empowers Indigenous Peoples, protects cultural sovereignty, and strengthens identity, trade, governance, and coordination.

The Moana Partner Chain is the backbone of this infrastructure.

This proposal will deliver the first deployed Moana chain prototype with:





Proof-of-Authority (PoA) consensus for rapid deployment



Full Cardano Testnet integration (metadata anchoring, stake snapshot ingestion, cross-chain signals)



Minotaur-ready architecture for future hybrid PoS



Identity, governance, and token pallets core to Indigenous community needs



Explorer + API for community and developer usage



Deploy-your-own-chain toolkit for other Indigenous nations



This prototype forms the basis of a global Federated Indigenous Digital Infrastructure Network connected to Cardano.



**Detailed Technical Approach**



1. Chain Core (Substrate / Rust)
    1. Aura + Grandpa PoA consensus
    2. Modular runtime
    3. Pallets for:
    4. governance & authority rotation
    5. identity & registry
    6. assets & tokens (UTIL baseline)
    7. Cardano integration
    8. Minotaur scaffolding
    9. Configurable genesis + authority set
2. Cardano Integration
    1. Cardano Testnet reserve address
    2. Metadata anchoring (governance, epoch markers, authority rotation)
    3. Stake snapshot retrieval
    4. Cross-chain signaling
    5. Minotaur block-weight interfaces
3. Node Deployment Toolkit	
    1. Docker Compose
    2. Helm charts
    3. Authority node deployment scripts
    4. Step-by-step “Launch Your Node” documentation

By the end of this project, we will deliver a publicly accessible, running Moana chain on Cardano Testnet including:
1. Functional PoA blockchain
2. Indigenous governance modules
3. Token & identity logic
4. Cardano integration (metadata & snapshots)
5. Explorer + API
6. A sample set of dApps demonstrating the chain
7. Documentation & onboarding material

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
The Moana Partner Chain brings a completely new category of on-chain activity to Cardano by enabling Indigenous organisations to join a sovereign blockchain network anchored to Cardano Testnet. This creates a pathway for real communities—across the Pacific, Turtle Island, Latin America and Africa—to generate meaningful on-chain metadata, governance signals, identity actions and economic activity.



Moana expands Cardano’s reach into global Indigenous movements seeking digital sovereignty, providing a flagship real-world use case that demonstrates Cardano’s multi-chain capability. By enabling communities to deploy their own nodes and participate directly in the network, Moana introduces a new form of decentralised, culturally governed adoption that no other blockchain ecosystem currently serves.



For the wider Cardano community, this project delivers:



A live partner-chain prototype connected to Cardano Testnet



Increased on-chain transactions through metadata anchoring and cross-chain signals



A template for future partner chains and multi-chain interoperability



Open-source pallets, documentation and deployment tooling available to all developers



A new user base that brings diversity, global reach, and long-term ecosystem growth



Moana creates real, values-driven adoption that strengthens Cardano as an ecosystem for communities, not just applications.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our team has deep experience delivering Indigenous-led digital infrastructure, blockchain systems, and Catalyst-funded projects. Mātou Collective and Galaxy Maps Engineering combine cultural governance expertise with strong technical capability in Rust, Substrate, Cardano integration, distributed systems, and full-stack development.



We validate feasibility through:

- Modular milestones with clear acceptance criteria
- Publicly deployed testnet chain accessible for community testing
- Continuous open-source development in GitLab
- Regular community updates, demos and feedback cycles
- Transparent reporting aligned with Catalyst standards

With a proven track record of delivering technical work, strong governance foundations, and an open development process, the team is well positioned to deliver the Moana prototype with high levels of trust, accountability and cultural integrity.

sub_fields.title: Project Milestones
sub_fields.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
sub_fields.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Chain Genesis & Authority Setup

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. A new Substrate-based Moana chain is created from the Partnerchain toolkit template
2. PoA consensus configured with initial Indigenous authority keys
3. Genesis configuration defining network parameters, authorities, token configuration, and chain ID
4. Runtime compiled to WASM with initial pallets enabled (balances, identity base, governance scaffold)
5. Two or more local validator nodes running and producing blocks
6. Foundational documentation for chain structure and setup

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. The chain compiles without errors and runs consistently for multiple sessions
2. Local authority nodes reach consensus and continue block production beyond 1,000 blocks
3. Genesis spec is reproducible by any team member following documentation
4. Chain telemetry shows stable finality throughput
5. RPC endpoints function locally (block queries, state queries, system information)

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. GitLab repository with runtime code, chain spec, and validator config
2. Logged output showing block heights and finalised blocks
3. Screenshots of two+ nodes syncing and producing blocks
4. Short video demo showing chain start-up, block production, and RPC queries
5. Telemetry snapshot or screenshots
6. Published documentation describing genesis and setup instructions

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Cardano Testnet Integration (Metadata Anchoring + Stake Snapshot Ingestion)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. Cardano Testnet address created for Moana reserve operations
2. Metadata anchoring module integrated (Substrate → Cardano)
3. Automated or semi-automated metadata posting tested from Moana events
4. Stake snapshot ingestion using Partnerchain toolkit reference models
5. On-chain storage of snapshot results inside the Moana runtime
6. Error handling and monitoring for cross-chain operations
7. Integration documentation and developer instructions

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. On-chain events in Moana generate Cardano Testnet metadata transactions
2. At least 10 metadata anchor events appear on Cardano Testnet, each representing Moana chain state
3. Stake snapshot data retrieved from Cardano Testnet and stored successfully in Moana storage
4. Cross-chain operations demonstrate repeatability and are documented with reference transaction IDs
5. Integration code compiles, runs, and is maintainable by external developers

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. List of Cardano Testnet transaction IDs containing Moana metadata
2. Chain logs showing successful snapshot ingestion and storage
3. GitLab merge requests with integration code
4. Demo video walking through the anchoring and ingestion process
5. Documentation describing how to test, reproduce, and verify the integration

sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Governance, Identity & Token Modules (Runtime Pallets)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. Custom governance pallet implementing authority rotation rules aligned with Indigenous structures
2. Identity/registry pallet supporting community membership or role assignment
3. Basic token asset pallet configured to support chain-native utility token flows
4. Governance events triggering metadata anchoring to Cardano Testnet
5. Test cases for governance actions, identity updates, and token transfers
6. Documentation describing the purpose and structure of each pallet

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. Governance actions (e.g., authority change proposals) successfully modify authority set on Moana
2. Identity entries can be created, updated, and queried via RPC
3. Token balances update correctly in runtime operations
4. Governance actions generate Cardano Testnet metadata entries
5. All pallets compile, run, and pass defined tests
6. Errors handled gracefully (invalid identity, invalid governance proposal, insufficient permissions)

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. GitLab code with pallet implementations and tests
2. RPC queries showing governance and identity entries
3. Cardano Testnet metadata transaction IDs generated by governance events
4. Demo video showing governance action → cross-chain metadata creation
5. Documentation describing logic, API, governance flow, and identity model

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Community Node Deployment Toolkit

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. Node deployment scripts (Docker, Docker Compose, systemd configuration, or binaries)
2. Configuration templates for bootnodes and network parameters
3. A “Community Node Onboarding Guide” explaining how any Indigenous organisation can join
4. Governance participation instructions for node operators
5. Security guidelines for key management and validator responsibilities
6. Internal testing of node deployment across at least 2 independent environments

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. A community node can be deployed outside the core team environment using documentation alone
2. Node successfully syncs with the Moana testnet from genesis or checkpoint
3. Node can submit transactions, query blocks, and participate in governance events
4. Node remains stable for multiple hours of operation
5. Security documentation addresses key management, updates, and monitoring

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. GitLab repo containing scripts, templates, and detailed onboarding documentation
2. Screenshots/logs from a community-deployed node joining the network
3. Demo video walking through the deployment and syncing process
4. Confirmation of at least one external test node successfully connecting
5. Checklist showing which onboarding steps were tested

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
- First Indigenous-led partner chain anywhere in Web3
- Unlocks a globally unique Cardano-aligned use case
- Produces meaningful on-chain activity
- Open-source, reusable template
- Enables federated adoption through node deployment
- Bridges Cardano into global Indigenous sovereignty networks
- High-leverage impact for 160k ADA
- Delivers a complete, open-source prototype

sub_fields.title: I Agree
sub_fields.description: I confirm that I have read, understand and shall adhere to the [Project Catalyst Platform Terms of Use](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-terms-of-use), [Project Catalyst Platform Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-privacy-policy), [Terms & Conditions](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions), [Fund Rules](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/fund-rules), [Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/catalyst-fc-privacy-policy). I understand that providing accurate and truthful information is essential for my proposal to remain eligible to participate in the current Fund.
